title: Poil.de.Carotte.1933.Duvivier.XviD.FRENCH.FZB.avi
description:
Transpos&eacute;e dans la France rurale de l?entre-deux-guerres, l?histoire du gar&ccedil;on aux cheveux roux devenu le souffre-douleur de sa vieille m&egrave;re, ou comment Poil de Carotte conquiert l?affection et l?estime de son misanthrope de p&egrave;re. R&eacute;alisme d?un autre &acirc;ge du cin&eacute;ma, et tendresse - rare chez Duvivier - teint&eacute;e de nostalgie.

Ce film, fait de petits tableaux cruels et path&eacute;tiques - avec par-ci, par-l&agrave;, des notations po&eacute;tiques - est bouleversant, gr&acirc;ce au jeune Robert Lynen que Duvivier avait d&eacute;couvert dans la rue et arrach&eacute; &agrave; la mis&egrave;re de son milieu familial. Jamais le r&ocirc;le (jou&eacute; g&eacute;n&eacute;ralement au th&eacute;&acirc;tre par des actrices travesties) n?a &eacute;t&eacute; mieux tenu, interpr&eacute;t&eacute; avec autant de naturel, autant de sensibilit&eacute; &eacute;corch&eacute;e. Et Harry Baur est d?une sobri&eacute;t&eacute; magistrale.
Jacques Siclier, T&eacute;l&eacute;rama, 13 mars 1977

Set in a rural France between the two Wars, is the story of a young redhead who is the scapegoat of his old mother. Or how does Poil de Carotte win the love and esteem of his misanthropic father. Realism from a different cinematic era plus tenderness (rare in Duvivier?s work) tinged with nostalgia.

Made up of short scenes both crual and pathetic, scattered with a few poetic touches, the film is overwhelming. Robert Lynen a young boy Duvivier discovered in the streets and rescued from the poverty of his familial environment is really fascinating. Generally played in the theatre by actresses dressed in boys, the role has never been interpreted so unaffectedly and with such naked compassion. Harry Baur is also masterfully moderate.
Jacques Siclier, T&eacute;l&eacute;rama, March 13, 1977
